intro: Tornelia laniata, commonly known as the roughleaf tornelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellowish flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Tornelia laniata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
